item.title: The legacy of Hulk Hogan's sex tape scandal
item.description: The 2016 legal battle raised questions about the line between freedom of expression and privacy, and what is actually newsworthy. Questions that needed to be reexamined in light of the invention of the internet, according to law experts.

item.title: What reporting in Gaza shows amid Trump's break from Netanyahu on starvation
item.description:
New light has emerged between Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Donald Trump, with the latter disputing Israel's claim that there is no starvation in Gaza.

But Consider This: Even as global outrage and assistance grows, aid agencies say only a total ceasefire will allow all the necessary aid in to get to those who desperately need it in Gaza.

item.title: Trying to keep your brain young? A big new study finds these lifestyle changes help
item.description: A study of more than 2,100 people ages 60 to 79 found that an intensive two-year program of mental and physical activities, along with a heart-healthy diet, improved memory and thinking.

item.title: Pete Buttigieg warns democrats can't go back to pre-Trump status quo
item.description:
Steve Inskeep speaks with former U.S. Secretary for Transportation Pete Buttigieg about where Democrats went wrong, how they can regain public trust, and why so many Americans don't believe what the government tells them about the Epstein files.

item.title: States sue USDA over efforts to gather food stamp data on tens of millions of people
item.description: Twenty-one states are suing after the USDA demanded states turn over sensitive data on food assistance applicants. The lawsuit calls the demand an "Orwellian surveillance campaign."
